intro: Horkelia congesta, commonly known as the Sierra daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats, including meadows and slopes, and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white. Horkelia congesta is known for its ability to withstand drought and poor soil conditions.
